title: Psalms Chapter 107 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 107 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 107 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 107.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107:1, why should we give thanks unto the LORD?
options: Because He is good and His mercy endureth forever
Because He created the heavens and the earth
Because He made the sea and the dry land
Because He gave us the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Because He is good and His mercy endureth forever
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:1 states that we should give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good and His mercy endureth forever.

questions.question: Who does Psalms 107:2 say should declare the LORD's redemption?
questions.correctAnswer: The redeemed of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:2 refers to the redeemed of the LORD as those who should say so, being redeemed from the hand of the enemy.

questions.question: From which directions did God gather the redeemed according to Psalms 107:3?
questions.correctAnswer: East, West, North, and South
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:3 states that God gathered them out of the lands from the east, west, north, and south.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107:4, where did the people wander?
options: In the wilderness in a solitary way
questions.correctAnswer: In the wilderness in a solitary way
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:4 describes the people wandering in the wilderness in a solitary way without finding a city to dwell in.

questions.question: What did the people's soul do when they were hungry and thirsty according to Psalms 107:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Their soul fainted in them
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:5 says that when the people were hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

questions.question: What did the people do in their trouble according to Psalms 107:6?
questions.correctAnswer: They cried unto the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:6 tells us that the people cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and He delivered them out of their distresses.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 107:9 says that the LORD satisfieth the longing soul and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:9 clearly states that God satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107:10, what condition are those who sit in darkness described as being in?
questions.correctAnswer: Bound in affliction and iron
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:10 describes those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death as being bound in affliction and iron.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 107:20: 'He sent his word, and ______ them, and delivered them from their destructions.'
questions.correctAnswer: healed
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:20 says, 'He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.'

questions.question: Who does Psalms 107:23 describe as going down to the sea in ships?
options: Those that do business in great waters
questions.correctAnswer: Those that do business in great waters
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:23 describes those who go down to the sea in ships as those who do business in great waters.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107:25, what does the LORD command to lift up the waves?
questions.correctAnswer: The stormy wind
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:25 says God commandeth and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 107:29 states that the LORD makes the storm a calm so that the waves thereof are still.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:29 confirms that the LORD maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

questions.question: What transformation does the LORD perform according to Psalms 107:33?
options: He turneth rivers into a wilderness and watersprings into dry ground
questions.correctAnswer: He turneth rivers into a wilderness and watersprings into dry ground
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:33 states that God turneth rivers into a wilderness and watersprings into dry ground.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107:38, how does God bless the people?
options: He blesseth them so they are multiplied greatly and their cattle do not decrease
He blesseth them by giving them gold and silver
He blesseth them by making them kings
He blesseth them by giving them long life
questions.correctAnswer: He blesseth them so they are multiplied greatly and their cattle do not decrease
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:38 says God blesseth them so that they are multiplied greatly and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 107:42 says that the righteous shall see it and rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:42 states that the righteous shall see it and rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 107 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 107 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Psalms 107, what biblical truth would you share about God's response to those who cry to Him in trouble?
options: God delivers them out of their distresses
questions.correctAnswer: God delivers them out of their distresses
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:6, 13, 19, and 28 clearly teach that when people cry unto the LORD in their trouble, He delivers them out of their distresses, showing His mercy and faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 teach us about gratitude and thanksgiving in the life of a believer?
options: Believers should sacrifice sacrifices of thanksgiving and declare God's works with rejoicing
Believers should only pray silently and not publicly
Gratitude is optional when life is easy
Thanksgiving should be delayed until all problems are solved
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should sacrifice sacrifices of thanksgiving and declare God's works with rejoicing
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:21-22 encourages believers to offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and declare God's works with rejoicing, emphasizing active gratitude and public praise.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, what is a practical way to witness to others based on God's deliverance?
options: Letting the redeemed declare God's wonderful works
questions.correctAnswer: Letting the redeemed declare God's wonderful works
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:2-3 and 8 emphasize that those whom the LORD has redeemed should declare His wonderful works to others, which is a key element of evangelism and witnessing.

questions.question: A believer is feeling lost and without direction like those who wandered in the wilderness. What encouragement does Psalms 107 offer about God's guidance?
options: God leads them forth by the right way to a city of habitation
God leaves them to wander endlessly
God requires them to find their own path
questions.correctAnswer: God leads them forth by the right way to a city of habitation
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:4-7 shows that although some wander in the wilderness, God leads them by the right way so they may find a place to dwell, illustrating His guidance and care.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107 reveal about God's mercy and goodness in times of physical hunger and spiritual thirst?
options: He satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness
He only cares about spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: He satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:8-9 teaches that God satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness, showing His care for both physical and spiritual needs.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 describe the consequences of rebelling against God's word and counsel?
options: They are bound in affliction and iron and suffer labor and lack of help
They are immediately forgiven without repentance
questions.correctAnswer: They are bound in affliction and iron and suffer labor and lack of help
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:10-12 explains that rebellion against God's word brings affliction and bondage, and they fall with no one to help, showing the gravity of disobedience.

questions.question: What biblical virtue does Psalms 107 highlight when describing those who are healed by God's word after affliction?
options: Trust in God's healing and salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God's healing and salvation
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:19-20 teaches that God sends His word to heal and deliver from destruction, encouraging believers to trust in His power to restore.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 107, those who face trials at sea experience God's deliverance when they cry to Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:23-30 describes those who go to sea and face storms; when they cry to God, He calms the storm and brings them safely to their desired haven.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from Psalms 107's depiction of God turning fruitful lands into barrenness and wilderness into watersprings?
options: God sovereignly blesses or disciplines according to people's wickedness or righteousness
God is indifferent to human conduct
questions.correctAnswer: God sovereignly blesses or disciplines according to people's wickedness or righteousness
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:33-35 shows God's power to change the land according to people's wickedness or blessing, teaching humility and dependence on God’s goodness.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with discouragement and oppression. What encouragement does Psalms 107 provide about God's care for the poor and afflicted?
options: God sets the poor on high and makes families like a flock
God only cares for the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: God sets the poor on high and makes families like a flock
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:40-41 assures that God lifts up the poor from affliction and blesses them with families, showing His compassionate care.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 instruct believers to respond when they witness God's deliverance in their own lives?
options: Praise the LORD for His goodness and wonderful works
questions.correctAnswer: Praise the LORD for His goodness and wonderful works
questions.explanation: Throughout Psalms 107, including verses 8, 15, 21, 31, and 43, the psalmist calls for praise and thanksgiving for God's mercy and wonderful works.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 107 says that the righteous shall see God's deliverance and _______.
questions.correctAnswer: rejoice
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:42 states that the righteous shall see God's deliverance and rejoice, highlighting the joy that comes from trusting Him.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107 say about the effect of God's word on those who are afflicted because of their foolishness and sins?
options: God sends His word and heals them, delivering them from destruction
God leaves them to their fate
questions.correctAnswer: God sends His word and heals them, delivering them from destruction
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:17-20 explains that fools afflicted by their sins cry to God, who sends His word to heal and deliver them, emphasizing God's mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 107 teaches that God can break the gates of brass and cut the bars of iron, symbolizing His power to free the captive.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:16 clearly states that God breaks the gates of brass and cuts the bars of iron, illustrating His power to liberate those in bondage.

questions.question: Based on Psalms 107, how should believers respond within the church assembly after experiencing God's blessings and deliverance?
options: Exalt Him in the congregation and praise Him in the assembly of the elders
questions.correctAnswer: Exalt Him in the congregation and praise Him in the assembly of the elders
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:32 instructs believers to exalt and praise God publicly in the assembly, highlighting the importance of corporate worship and testimony.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 107 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 107.

questions.question: In Psalms 107, who is called to give thanks because of enduring mercy?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:1 states, 'O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.' This calls specifically for thanks to the LORD.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, from which directions did the LORD gather the redeemed?
questions.correctAnswer: North, South, East, West
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:3 says the LORD gathered them out of the lands from the east, west, north, and south, indicating a complete gathering from all directions.

questions.question: What metaphor is used in Psalms 107 to describe those who wandered without finding a city to dwell in?
questions.correctAnswer: Wilderness in a solitary way
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:4 uses the imagery of wandering in the wilderness in a solitary way to describe those without a home or rest.

questions.question: In Psalms 107, what is the response of those who are hungry and thirsty and whose soul fainted?
questions.correctAnswer: They cried unto the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:6 shows that in their trouble, the hungry and thirsty cried unto the LORD, who delivered them.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107:9 say the LORD does for the soul?
options: Satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness
questions.correctAnswer: Satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:9 highlights God's provision by satisfying the longing soul and filling the hungry soul with goodness.

questions.question: The phrase 'bound in affliction and iron' in Psalms 107:10 metaphorically represents what condition?
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual bondage due to rebellion
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:10-11 indicates those bound in affliction and iron are so because they rebelled against God's words, showing spiritual and moral captivity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the repeated call 'Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness' in Psalms 107?
options: It emphasizes the theme of thanksgiving and God's wondrous works
It signals a warning against disobedience
It is a historical recount of battles
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the theme of thanksgiving and God's wondrous works
questions.explanation: This refrain, appearing repeatedly (e.g., Psalms 107:8, 15, 21, 31), structurally frames the psalm highlighting praise and thanksgiving for God's acts.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 portray the LORD's intervention when the wicked are oppressed and brought low?
options: He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:39-40 describes God’s judgment on the wicked by pouring contempt on princes and making them wander in desolation.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Psalms 107 through the recurring motif of distress and deliverance?
options: Chiasm with repeated cycles of trouble and salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm with repeated cycles of trouble and salvation
questions.explanation: The psalm’s structure uses chiasm by cycling through episodes of distress followed by cries to God and deliverance, reinforcing God’s saving power.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the phrase 'He sent his word, and healed them' in Psalms 107:20 in relation to New Testament themes?
options: Foreshadows Christ’s healing ministry through the Word
Refers only to physical healing in the Old Testament
Illustrates the failure of human wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Foreshadows Christ’s healing ministry through the Word
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:20’s reference to healing by God’s word foreshadows New Testament themes where Jesus heals and delivers through his spoken word and authority.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, what natural phenomenon is used as a metaphor for human distress and God's power to save?
questions.correctAnswer: Stormy seas and waves
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:23-30 describes those at sea caught in storms as a metaphor for distress, with God calming the storms showing divine deliverance.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 107 describes God’s ability to transform barren land into fruitful land as a sign of His blessing on the people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:33-38 speaks of God turning deserts into watersprings and fruitful land, symbolizing restoration and blessing.

questions.question: What is the role of the 'assembly of the elders' in Psalms 107:32 regarding the praise of the LORD?
options: A setting where praise and exaltation occur publicly
A place of judgment against the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: A setting where praise and exaltation occur publicly
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:32 calls for praise in the congregation and assembly of elders, emphasizing communal worship and public exaltation of God.

questions.question: Which Hebrew concept reflected in Psalms 107 relates to the enduring mercy of God mentioned in verse 1 and echoes throughout the psalm?
questions.correctAnswer: Chesed (lovingkindness)
questions.explanation: The term 'lovingkindness' in Psalms 107:43 corresponds to the Hebrew word chesed, denoting God's faithful mercy which endures forever as introduced in verse 1.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'they stagger like a drunken man' in Psalms 107:27 within the cultural context of the ancient Near East?
options: Illustrates extreme distress and loss of control
Describes literal drunkenness as a sin
Indicates physical sickness unrelated to distress
questions.correctAnswer: Illustrates extreme distress and loss of control
questions.explanation: In the ancient Near East, staggering like a drunken man was a vivid metaphor for helplessness and confusion, used here to describe sailors at the brink of despair.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 107 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 107 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, what is the primary reason the redeemed should give thanks to the LORD?
options: Because He is good and His mercy endures forever
Because He created the heavens and the earth
questions.correctAnswer: Because He is good and His mercy endures forever
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:1 calls for giving thanks to the LORD specifically because He is good and His mercy endures forever, highlighting God's enduring lovingkindness. This is consistent with Exodus 34:6-7, Lamentations 3:22-23, 1 Chronicles 16:34, and Ephesians 2:4-5, which affirm God's mercy and goodness as foundational attributes.

questions.question: In Psalms 107, how does God respond when the afflicted cry to Him in their trouble?
options: He delivers them out of their distresses
He sends angels to judge them
questions.correctAnswer: He delivers them out of their distresses
questions.explanation: Multiple verses (Psalms 107:6, 13, 19, 28) emphasize that when the afflicted cry to the LORD, He delivers them from their distresses. This reflects God's compassionate nature as also seen in Psalm 34:17, Isaiah 41:10, Matthew 11:28-30, and Romans 8:38-39.

questions.question: Which imagery does Psalms 107 use to describe those who have rebelled against God's words and are bound in affliction?
options: Sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death, bound in iron
Walking in the light and freedom
questions.correctAnswer: Sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death, bound in iron
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:10 describes rebellious sinners as sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death, bound in affliction and iron, symbolizing spiritual bondage due to sin. This is consistent with Isaiah 9:2, John 8:34, Romans 6:16, and Hebrews 2:14-15 regarding bondage to sin and death.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107 say God does to those who are foolish because of their transgressions and iniquities?
options: He afflicts them and their soul abhors all manner of meat
He immediately pardons them without consequence
He blesses their fields and vineyards
questions.correctAnswer: He afflicts them and their soul abhors all manner of meat
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:17-18 states that fools because of their transgressions are afflicted and their soul abhors all manner of meat, illustrating the consequences of sin. This aligns with Proverbs 1:32, Romans 1:18-32, Hebrews 12:6, and Revelation 3:19 on discipline for sin.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 describe God's intervention in the lives of those who go down to the sea in ships?
options: He commands the stormy wind and brings the waves to a calm
He abandons them to the sea
He causes the ships to sink
He makes the sea dry up
questions.correctAnswer: He commands the stormy wind and brings the waves to a calm
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:25-29 depicts God's control over the sea and storms, calming the waves when the sailors cry out to Him. This reflects God's sovereign power over nature as seen in Job 38:8-11, Mark 4:39, Psalm 89:9, and Jonah 1:4.

questions.question: What theological truth does Psalms 107 express about God's ability to transform the environment for His people?
options: He turns rivers into wilderness and wilderness into water springs
He leaves the land barren forever
questions.correctAnswer: He turns rivers into wilderness and wilderness into water springs
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:33-35 shows God's sovereign power in transforming nature—rivers to wilderness and wilderness to water springs—demonstrating His providential care. This is consistent with Isaiah 35:6-7, Ezekiel 36:25-27, John 7:38, and Revelation 22:1-2 regarding God's renewing power.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, what is the ultimate response God desires from men for His goodness and wonderful works?
questions.correctAnswer: Praise and thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Repeatedly (e.g., Psalms 107:8, 15, 21, 31) the Psalm calls for men to praise the LORD and offer thanksgiving for His goodness and wonderful works. This is echoed in Psalm 100:4, Hebrews 13:15, 1 Thessalonians 5:18, and Philippians 4:6 where praise and thanksgiving are proper responses to God's grace.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107 teach about the condition of the soul when it is satisfied by the LORD?
options: The longing soul is satisfied and the hungry soul is filled with goodness
The soul remains empty and restless
The soul becomes proud and selfish
questions.correctAnswer: The longing soul is satisfied and the hungry soul is filled with goodness
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:9 declares that God satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness, teaching that God meets spiritual needs fully. This aligns with John 6:35, Psalm 23:1, Isaiah 55:1-3, and Matthew 5:6 about God’s provision and satisfaction.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 describe the fate of the poor and afflicted compared to the proud and wicked?
options: God sets the poor on high and pours contempt on princes
God exalts the proud and ignores the poor
The wicked are blessed and the poor are oppressed
questions.correctAnswer: God sets the poor on high and pours contempt on princes
questions.explanation: Verses 40-41 teach that God humbles the proud and exalts the poor, demonstrating His justice and mercy. This is supported by Proverbs 3:34, James 4:6, Luke 1:52, and Psalm 113:7-8 where God raises the lowly and humbles the proud.

questions.question: What theological theme is illustrated by God breaking the gates of brass and cutting the bars of iron in sunder in Psalms 107?
options: God’s power to free His people from bondage
questions.correctAnswer: God’s power to free His people from bondage
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:16 uses imagery of breaking gates and cutting bars to show God’s liberating power from captivity and sin. This parallels Exodus 14:27-28, Isaiah 61:1, Luke 4:18, and Galatians 5:1 about God's deliverance from bondage.

questions.question: Which repeated refrain in Psalms 107 emphasizes the importance of recognizing God’s wonderful works to humanity?
options: "Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!"
"The wicked shall perish from the earth"
"The earth is the LORD's and the fullness thereof"
"Blessed is the man who fears the LORD"
questions.correctAnswer: "Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!"
questions.explanation: This refrain appears multiple times (Psalms 107:8, 15, 21, 31) emphasizing praise for God's goodness and works, underlining worship as a central response. Similar themes appear in Psalm 145:7, Revelation 19:5, Isaiah 25:1, and 1 Chronicles 16:8.

questions.question: How does Psalms 107 describe the condition of those who wander in the wilderness without a city to dwell in?
options: Hungry, thirsty, and fainting in soul
questions.correctAnswer: Hungry, thirsty, and fainting in soul
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:4-5 depicts wanderers in the wilderness as hungry, thirsty, and fainting in soul, symbolizing spiritual and physical desperation. This correlates with Deuteronomy 8:3, Matthew 4:4, Psalm 42:1-2, and John 6:35 concerning human dependence on God.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'he sent his word, and healed them' in Psalms 107?
options: It shows God's healing power through His word
It refers to a human doctor
It means the people healed themselves
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God's healing power through His word
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:20 highlights God's healing through His word, teaching divine power to restore spiritually and physically. This is consistent with Isaiah 55:10-11, John 1:1-14, Hebrews 4:12, and James 5:14-16 about the power of God's word and healing.

questions.question: According to Psalms 107, what is the result when God brings the storm to a calm for those at sea?
options: They are glad because they are quiet and brought to their desired haven
They curse God for their troubles
questions.correctAnswer: They are glad because they are quiet and brought to their desired haven
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:29-30 shows that calming the storm brings gladness and safety to those at sea, illustrating God's providential care. This reflects Mark 4:39-41, Psalm 46:1-3, Isaiah 43:2, and John 14:27 about God's peace amid trials.

questions.question: What does Psalms 107 teach about the relationship between wisdom and understanding God's lovingkindness?
options: Those who are wise and observe these things will understand the lovingkindness of the LORD
Wisdom has no role in understanding God's love
Only the foolish comprehend God's lovingkindness
questions.correctAnswer: Those who are wise and observe these things will understand the lovingkindness of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 107:43 teaches that wisdom involves observing God's works to understand His lovingkindness, emphasizing the theological virtue of wisdom. This is supported by Proverbs 2:6, James 1:5, Ecclesiastes 7:12, and Ephesians 1:17-18 on wisdom and knowledge of God.
